alert.note: Alert for Fresno-Tulare Foothills; Fresno-Tulare Lower Sierra; Mariposa Madera Foothills; Mariposa-Madera Lower Sierra; South End Sierra Foothills; South End of the Lower Sierra (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 30 at 5:07AM PDT until March 30 at 4:00PM PDT by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM PDT THIS MORNING... ...FLOOD WATCH HAS EXPIRED... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of central California, including the following areas, Fresno-Tulare Foothills, Fresno-Tulare Lower Sierra, Mariposa Madera Foothills, Mariposa-Madera Lower Sierra, South End Sierra Foothills and South End of the Lower Sierra. * WHEN...Until 11 AM PDT this morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy Rain from Continuing Showers. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood The Flood Watch for the Sierra Foothills has been EXTENDED UNTIL 11 AM PDT.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Fresno-Tulare Foothills; Fresno-Tulare Lower Sierra; Mariposa Madera Foothills; Mariposa-Madera Lower Sierra; South End Sierra Foothills; South End of the Lower Sierra
